catalog_info.title: Reformation and the Making of Religious Practice in Britain and colonial America, c. 1550-1700
catalog_info.notes: Offered jointly with the Divinity School as 2270.
catalog_info.description: A research seminar, this course covers the coming of Reformed (Calvinist) Protestantism to England and Scotland in the sixteenth century and the maturing of the Puritan movement in those countries and New England in the seventeenth.  Attentive to theology and politics, this course also explores lived religion, especially devotional practice.
